title: refactor(kraken_ws_client): improve the api and implementation, wip
refactor(kraken_ws_client): improve api, typed ticker subscription
chore: update deps to latest versions
Add support for TradeVolume private endpoint
body: This is an authenticated endpoint, taking one or more pairs comma separated, eg. "ADAUSD" or "ADAUSD,KAVAUSD" in addition to the optional fee-info. The response tells the level of volume done in the last 30 days revolving in addition to current fee and next fee ( if any ) and next volume level for discount ( if any ).

title: DepositStatus::fee field is not present while the deposit is settling
body: This is a minor change in the public API, not sure if this would be a problem or not. I observed that while a deposit is pending, the `fee` field is not returned by the Kraken API, which causes the response deserialization to fail

title: add convinience functions to OHLC
body: The struct is error prone to work with, this PR adds some simple convenience functions

title: add get_open_positions
body:
I've implemented this for myself, but might as well contribute back if you find it useful.
Feel free to improve this PR, as currently it does not support all query parameters available, just the ones I needed :)

title: Add enum for type, subtype and aclass and add serialize trait
body:
I added three enums for `type`, `subtype` and `aclass`. The Kraken doc is not on par with the real api. But it should be easy to adjust. 
Additionally I added the `Serialize` trait. I like to cache the results without the need to map the values to new objects. Sadly it is not that easy to add the serialization feature from outside. I hope you are agreeing that it make sense to have this in this library.

title: Mark parameter optional
body: For me the api returns null for some items for `userref` and `postxid`. The rest api documentation is not 100% clear about if they are optional. At least in reality they are it seems.

title: Add Ledgers and DepositStatus endpoint
body: Hey, maybe not the quality you are aiming for. But maybe it helps as a starting point. Currently I can not spend a lot of time on this PR to add tests, etc..
